About

TL;DR

Words: map nerd | programmer | designer | people person | empathetic | ambitious | straightforward | detail-oriented | team player

Summary: A student aptly summed me up like this: "I appreciate your take-no-bullshit attitude, but also your eagerness to compliment good work."

Currently: Working on my Master's in Cartography & GIS at UW–Madison. Looking for what comes next.

My guiding life principles:

  • Take calculated risks. What’s the worst that can happen?
  • If you don’t ask, you’ll never know.
  • Communication is key.
  • JFDI.

Here's my resume or get in touch for more details.

Things you didn’t ask but now you know

  • The terrain in the footer of the website shows portions of all three branches of the Andes Mountains in Colombia. The best hike I ever did was in El Cocuy National Park on the far right side of the image.
  • I was featured on House Hunters International while living in Bogota, Colombia.
  • I will eat ice cream anytime, anywhere.
  • Restrepo Leather, a company that I started with my husband, was featured in GQ’s Best Stuff of 2013.
  • I was captain of my college ultimate frisbee team and can throw a mean hammer.
  • Let's talk.
